Title: WMS Analyst
Description:
The WMS Analyst for our Warehouse Management System (WMS) will primarily serve Ulta’s Distribution Center by providing timely and accurate data, process and system analysis for improving warehousing and transportation efficiencies. The Analyst is expected to be part of a rotational 24/7 on-call group that will support the operation at all hours. The role has multiple responsibilities that are carried out without direct supervision from management, yet hold significant operational, efficiency, and financial implications.Top Reasons to Work with UsGreat pay, excellent benefits and career growth!!What You Will Be Doing• Support the Distribution Center’s 24/7 operation in regards to the Manhattan WMOS, WCS, and Lightning Pick systems • Troubleshooting complex systems issues, creating and maintaining SQL-based Business Intelligence Reporting, active partnership with appropriate departments from ULTA HQ and various vendors. • This position is the first point of contact in the systems issue escalation process and is required to make informed, educated decisions apart from the WMS Manager. • Maintain inventory integrity between Manhattan WMOS and SAP. • This responsibility has both operational and financial implications to ULTA and is done under minimal or no supervision from management. • This is a highly impactful responsibility which requires daily interaction including reviewing & maintaining inventory sync & error handling reports, same day research and resolution of discrepancies, participating and leading daily inventory sync calls & collaborating with the HQ partners, Finance team and DC Ops teams to provide training and guidance for sync discrepancy prevention • Maintain slotting requirements with input from the operation. • Keep management, other team members and other departmental employees aware of obstacles and status changes in a timely manner. Use proper judgment to determine when such communication is necessary. • Consider the need for other team members to support their areas of responsibility and openly shares an understanding of these areas. • Ensure his/her areas of expertise are covered when absent. • Analyze production issues as necessary to determine the cause of the issue and determine the necessary course of action for resolution. • Responsible for testing the solution and verifying that the production issue has indeed been resolved following implementation. • Consider technical and performance consequences when creating design deliverables. • Use technical skills in the appropriate toolset to analyze data and develop necessary "work arounds." Deliverables in this area are typically used to support the design and support process, not to be rolled out for productive use by business users. • Create and deliver user documentation as necessary to ensure proper use of changed and newly implemented efforts.What You Need for this PositionJOB REQUIREMENTS Minimum: Bachelor’s degree in related field (Computer Science, Business, IT, Analytics, Engineering), or equivalent related work experience Executive level communication skills possessing the ability to directly and clearly communicate complex ideas to a team Ability to multi-task and thrive under pressure Experience developing training programs and coaching both leaders and frontline employees 1-3 years of Manhattan experience OR 5+ years of Oracle/DBA/Analytics experience Experience writing SQL Scripting or ad-hoc reporting experience Experience with live systems, such as SAP Proficiency in Microsoft Access and Excel High learning agility. Position will often require learning new areas of business, new software and new technology. Strong experience with data analysis/design and systems analysis/design. Experience with warehouse management systems. Experience with transportation management systems. Experience with labor management systems. MS Excel, Word, Access SPECIAL POSITION REQUIREMENTS Preferred: 3+ years of leadership experience, preferably in a distribution environment 3+ years of WMS experience 1+ years of SOX compliance experience 1+ yearsWhat's In It for YouGreat pay, excellent benefits and career growth!!So, if you are a WMS Analyst, please apply today!
                

                    Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Title: ISO Analyst
Description:
We are a top wireless communications company that focuses on location, messaging, and navigation. Our solutions provide cloud-based messaging platforms for Emergency Response and telemedicine technologies. We develop secure mobile and platform solutions for operators and enterprises worldwide. If you are a ISO Analyst with experience, please read on!What You Will Be Doing•Develop and execute internal audit programs and facilitate external audits in compliance with requirements, internal SOP’s, and customer requirements •Develop and interpret security policies and procedures to identify security issues and risks, and work with management to develop mitigation plans •Monitor and evaluate business unit performance on key security issues and programs, recommend corrective action programs as appropriate including KPIs •Develop and deliver orientation training, ISO initiatives training, or other training to employees as applicable, includes material creation •Evaluate and recommend new and emerging security products and technologies •Participate in security incident handling •Supports customer relationships and business units by ensuring complete understanding of customer security requirements and enables the delivery of viable security responses. •Craft/edit appropriate policies, procedures, standards and guidelines •Liaise with Product Management, Development, QA, Operations teams, and other areas of business in building awareness of regulatory requirements and timing for reporting and labeling. •Develop security testing for products in the development cycle •Act as business unit representative for corporate compliance steering committee •Provide document control development related to quality systemsWhat You Need for this Position•Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related STEM degree.•3-5 years of experience with experience maintaining an ISO 9001 QMS and 27001 Information Security programs. •Must be proficient in root cause analysis, quality system structuring, document control, and performing/managing audits.•Proven experience and detailed technical knowledge in security engineering, system and network security, authentication and security protocols, cryptography, and application security. •Degree in Computer Science or equivalent desired.What's In It for You• Competitive base salary• Paid time off• Exceptionally priced medical, vision, and dental coverage• Flexible spending opportunities• Tuition reimbursement / Gym reimbursement• Paid life insurance• Incentive stock option planSo, if you are an ISO Analyst with experience, please apply today!
                

                    Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Title: Financial Analyst
Description:
If you are a Financial Analyst with experience, please read on!Top Reasons to Work with UsThe Financial Analyst will be responsible for supporting and executing the core processes for forecasting, budgeting, and analysis for decision support of the team. The Financial Analyst will play a key role in the Company's internal financial reporting and will work with people at all levels of the organization to report, monitor and manage key financial and non-financial performance indicators.What You Will Be Doing-Prepare and analyze reporting at all levels of the organization on actuals, forecasts and prior fiscal year-Manages, in partnership with the Company's Corporate Finance team, the commercial operating expense budgeting, forecasting and spending targets investigating and articulating the key drivers of business results.-Development and analysis of weekly operating statistics and analyses to support Commercial team- Research and analysis of variances to ensure data accuracy-Responsible for developing financial modeling, financial statement analysis, decision modeling, reporting and ad-hoc analysis to support strategic initiatives -Support, analyze, and assist in the preparation and review of the Company's annual operating budget including:Assists in the continued development of budgeting, financial forecasting, operating plan and modeling tools-Detailed support and analysis of the Company's commercial departmental budgets-Development of presentations to help summarize budget results in a comprehensive and easy-to-understand format-Analyzes actual operating results and identifies key financial and operating issues to be addressed; Title: Security Analyst
Description:
If you are a Security Analyst with experience, please read on!Based in beautiful San Antonio, TX, we are a an innovative managed security service provider with a mission to protect customer data and make technology available, productive, and secure with the strongest talent in the industry. We are looking for a hardworking Security Analyst who has strong SIEM experience in an information security role to add to our growing team. If this sounds like something you'd be interested in, we'd love to tell you more about this opportunity!What You Will Be DoingThe Security Analyst is responsible for reviewing system log events and data packets to determine whether activity is normal or malicious. The Security Analyst will ensure that aspects of the customers’ environments are identified and understood to enable accurate actionable reporting for other tiers. Analysts will also participate in developing processes, procedures, training, etc. for new technologies. Strong knowledge of incident response principles and phases. Other duties may include:-Performing systems and network analysis of intrusions to customers’ network infrastructure, applications, operating systems, firewalls, proxy devices, malware detection and more and work as part of the team conducting preliminary incident response, event analysis and threat intelligence.-Conduct initial and ongoing tuning of customers’ environments from on-boarding to day 2.-Participate in solutions development for new products as they are introduced to the organization.-Handling escalations from Security Specialists and Associate Analysts.-Reviewing security events that are detrimental to the overall security posture; analyze and detect sophisticated and nuanced attacks, discern false positives.-Providing both strategic analysis and near real-time auditing, investigating, reporting, and remediation, coordinating and tracking of security-related activities for customers.-Conducting vulnerability testing.What You Need for this Position-3+ experience in an information security role-Knowledge of web application security and in vulnerability management required-SIEM experience is a MUST: Interpret log data, read log messages, packet inspection-IPS/IDS: Writing signatures or investigating events-Network security attacks, vectors and network protocols including TCP, UDP, ICMP, SNMP, HTTP, and FTP-Experience with network troubleshooting of workstations, server, switches, and routers-Operating systems knowledge and systems administration skills for various versions of UNIX, LINUX, and Windows and ability to read and understand Windows logs-Strong knowledge of the various security solutions such as AV, IPS, IDS, SIEM, firewalls and proxies-Incident Handling procedures-Information security in multi-platform environmentProfessional certifications such as CompTIA+, Network+, SANS/GIAC are a plusWhat's In It for You-Top pay!-Comprehensive benefits-401K-PTO/Sick leave-Work with cutting edge technology-Huge growth potential!So, if you are a Security Analyst with experience, please apply today!

Title: IT Audit/Compliance Analyst
Description:
If you are an IT Audit/Compliance Analyst, please read on!We are a global organization looking for an IT Audit/Compliance Analyst to join our team.  This is a new position within a newly formed group of internal IT auditing that sits inside of our technology department.  The goal of this role and the team is to ensure that all technology whether applications, infrastructure and operations are compliant to the company's internal processes and controls and external compliance that is required.  You will create policies and procedures around IT compliance and educate the department to ensure adherence to them.  This role will perform IT audits and control reviews for anything within the technology function responsibility.  You will perform and review all SOX compliance testing and communicate issues and resolutions.  Continually research and be aware of internal and external compliance that requires attention and possible process development or changes. Perform periodic reviews on all IT providing direction where necessary.  You must have experience auditing software implementations through their entire SDLC.  You will own your projects from start to finish therefore project management skills are required.What You Need for this PositionRequirements:Bachelor's degree in business, computer science or related field5+ years performing IT Audit and ComplianceProject management experience, PMI or Prince2Experience creating and documenting compliance processes and proceduresKnowledge of SOX, NIST, COBIT and SSA18 SOC reportingFamiliarity with IT SecurityExperience evaluating software implementationsPluses:Certifications - CPA, CIS, CISA highly desiredWhat's In It for YouWe offer a competitive salary and the ability to grow in a new team!Local Candidates ONLY please.So, if you are an IT Audit/Compliance Analyst, please apply today!

Title: Senior Marketing Analyst
Description:
If you are a Senior Marketing Analyst with experience, please read on!What You Will Be DoingSUMMARY: The Marketing Manager / Marketing Analyst will be responsible for managing direct marketing campaigns (catalog and email) from inception to completion including providing input on strategy and analyzing results against goals to improve campaign effectiveness. Works with the e-Commerce Director, Creative Director, Web Merchant and other marketing members to generate the profitable acquisition of new customers and retention and reactivation of existing customers. As the key owner of the customer file, the position is responsible for optimizing customer segments through direct marketing channels, analyzing, reporting, forecasting and budgeting the direct marketing activities.Essential Job Responsibilities: •Manages the direct marketing and contact plan (circulation / segment plan) to optimize return-on-investment for customer acquisition, retention and reactivation. •Identifies, develops and delivers the execution of high-impact direct marketing campaigns primarily through email and DM catalogs and mail pieces.•Manages all day-to-day aspects of the Direct Marketing program including list selection, working with the creative and copy teams, budgeting, reporting, optimization and vendor management.•Leverages the newly launched Marketing Database (MDB) and analytics tools (Campaign Runner, Tableau), and supports email and catalog marketing as the lead resource on list selection and segmentation. •As a power-user of the MDB, provides ad-hoc analysis and reporting. Gains a deep understanding of all customer segments through research and analysis to influence direct mail and email channel strategy.•Manages all triggered and batch & blast email campaigns.•Responsible for planning and developing the marketing calendar and communications.•Acts as the primary owner of key reporting and analysis, response reporting, ROI estimates and analysis, customer database KPI’s including monthly reports, file size (customer retention / loyalty, acquisition, re-activation, etc.), marketing goal tracking, and campaign performance. •Forecasts program performance and partners closely with the marketing leadership team to develop direct marketing program budgets.•Manages test design (including hold-out and A/B split, and multi-variate tests with customer segments, creative and messaging) as well as post-mortem reporting.•Works with the Senior Vice President of Marketing and others to set strategic targets and goals for direct mail programs.•Works with the creative team and copywriter, sales manager, and other marketing and merchandising members to ensure product and channel messaging is effective and compelling.•Completes position-specific training, and engages in continuous development.Qualifications: •Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or relevant coursework required•5+ years of utilizing both direct marketing databases and executing high-impact, direct-response marketing campaigns (catalog and ecommerce environments preferred)•5+ years of reporting and admin management•Strong analytical skills and eager to use quantitative analysis of results to improve the program•Exceptionally organized, “buttoned up” and detail oriented; has a sense of ownership with a commitment to continual improvement•Excellent written and verbal communication skills; strong creative insight and brand experience; must be comfortable communicating across diverse audiences•Experience managing marketing automation platforms and interfacing with marketing service providers•Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a results-driven, team-oriented environment•Power user of Excel preferred. Strong computer skills, working knowledge of MS Office (Word, Outlook, etc.)•Experience with EMS (email marketing systems), data flows, and marketing automation tools (such as Campaign Runner and Tableau) a plusWhat You Need for this PositionAt Least 3 Years of experience and knowledge of:- Excel- Tableau- Pivot Tables- SQL- Advanced statistics & analytics and visualizationSo, if you are a Senior Marketing Analyst with experience, please apply today!
                

                    Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.
Skills:
Preferred Skills
                
                    
                            
                                
                                    
                                    Excel
                                    
                                
                            
                            
                                
                                    
                                    Tableau
                                    
                                
                            
                            
                                
                                    
                                    Pivot Tables
                                    
                                
                            
                            
                                
                                    
                                    SQL
                                    
                                
                            
                            
                                
                                    
                                    Advanced statistics & analytics and visualization

Gains a deep understanding of all customer segments through research and analysis to influence direct mail and email channel strategy.•Manages all triggered and batch & blast email campaigns.•Responsible for planning and developing the marketing calendar and communications.•Acts as the primary owner of key reporting and analysis, response reporting, ROI estimates and analysis, customer database KPI’s including monthly reports, file size (customer retention / loyalty, acquisition, re-activation, etc.), marketing goal tracking, and campaign performance. •Forecasts program performance and partners closely with the marketing leadership team to develop direct marketing program budgets.•Manages test design (including hold-out and A/B split, and multi-variate tests with customer segments, creative and messaging) as well as post-mortem reporting.•Works with the Senior Vice President of Marketing and others to set strategic targets and goals for direct mail programs.•Works with the creative team and copywriter, sales manager, and other marketing and merchandising members to ensure product and channel messaging is effective and compelling.•Completes position-specific training, and engages in continuous development.Qualifications: •Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or relevant coursework required•5+ years of utilizing both direct marketing databases and executing high-impact, direct-response marketing campaigns (catalog and ecommerce environments preferred)•5+ years of reporting and admin management•Strong analytical skills and eager to use quantitative analysis of results to improve the program•Exceptionally organized, “buttoned up” and detail oriented; has a sense of ownership with a commitment to continual improvement•Excellent written and verbal communication skills; strong creative insight and brand experience; must be comfortable communicating across diverse audiences•Experience managing marketing automation platforms and interfacing with marketing service providers•Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a results-driven, team-oriented environment•Power user of Excel preferred. Strong computer skills, working knowledge of MS Office (Word, Outlook, etc.)•Experience with EMS (email marketing systems), data flows, and marketing automation tools (such as Campaign Runner and Tableau) a plusWhat You Need for this PositionAt Least 3 Years of experience and knowledge of:- Excel- Tableau- Pivot Tables- SQL- Advanced statistics & analytics and visualizationSo, if you are a Lead Marketing Analyst with experience, please apply today!
                

                    Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Title: Manufacturing Quality Analyst
Description:
If you are a Manufacturing Quality Analyst or Technician with strong QA experience, please read on!As one of the most experienced and integrated aluminum foundries in Massachusetts, we boast a high production facility with in-house production processes from core making and assembly, heat treating, CNC machining, product final assembly and supply chain management. We specialize in complex, highly-cored casting for numerous applications in sizes ranging from a few ounces to 100+ pounds, all produced on state-of-the-art equipment.We are seeking a Quality Analyst or Technician with experience to join our team of casting experts!Top Reasons to Work with Us- Well Established Leader for Over 50+ Years- Great Compensation (50k-65k)- Leading State of the Art Technologies- Great Team and Leadership- Vacation/PTO- Generous Benefits PackageWhat You Will Be Doing•Determine and/or obtain part-specific PMM requirements for new and existing parts•Enters part-specific requirements into PMM Tracker and saves supporting documentation to network directory•Inspects parts using various inspection equipment and basic tools (calipers, gauges, fixtures, etc.) •Accept or reject part per the required specification•Enters inspection results into Tracker and saves to network directory•Completes all necessary paperwork accurately, efficiently, and in a timely manner•Creates and affixes labels, tags, and/or other rejection markers to inspected product dispositioned as nonconforming or potentially nonconforming and reports quality issues to appropriate personnel•Ensures that all required inspections are performed, passed, and recorded in PMM Tracker before releasing product to Final Inspection operation•Cross trains in metal and sand testing, operation of FARO laser scanner and Geomagic software, and casting x-ray review and disposition•Regular attendance is an essential function of this positionWhat You Need for this Position•Documentation:  Read and understand drawings, procedures, work instructions, equipment Standard Operating Procedures, specifications, simple instructions, short correspondence, comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence•Computer:  Good working knowledge of Windows, Excel, Word, Outlook, Geomagic Control X, Quality Analyst•Soft Skills:  Willing and able to clearly and effectively communicate in English language (both written and verbal) in one-on-one, small group situations, and with all levels of the organization.  •Math:  Add, subtract, divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals; trigonometry; statistical process control•GD&T:  Understand and interpret prints and specifications•Contact measurement skills:  Use of functional gauges, height gauges, verniers, etc.- Machining Background preferredSo, if you are a Quality Technician or Quality Analyst with experience, please apply today!
                

                    Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.
Skills:

Title: Senior Tax Analyst
Description:
If you are a Senior Tax Analyst with experience, please read on!Top Reasons to Work with UsOur firm specializes in domestic and international tax consulting and compliance services. We work closely and efficiently with our client’s existing accounting firm and legal counsel. Our tax professionals have skill sets equal to those at the Big 4 and provide broad-based practical and operationally oriented tax advice at fees lower than those charged by the Big 4What You Will Be DoingThe Senior Tax Analyst role requires experience to effectively understand clients’ needs and provide solutions.  Primary responsibilities involve tax compliance, tax accounting, tax research and planning projects for the firm’s sophisticated clientele.  Experience in U.S. federal, international, state and local tax and tax provision is desired in this role.  We will build upon your technical strengths in order to grow your expertise in other tax areas.  Our firm builds well-rounded tax professionals to serve a myriad of client needs which leads to continued professional growth.  Our culture is to develop trusted tax advisors with sound judgement with the highest ethical standards in the profession.  The Senior Tax Analyst will be responsible for a range of projects including:   -          Preparation and review of federal, state, and local tax returns and international tax forms for the firm’s clients. -          Proper maintenance and reconciliation of tax general ledger accounts for the firm’s clients. -          Prepare, calculate and document various portions of clients’ current and deferred tax provision and effective tax rate. -          Prepare tax research, planning, compliance, and documentation required for tax filings and tax audits. -          Preparation and review of the quarterly and year-end tax provision and related financial statements. -          Proactively identify areas for process improvements and implement solutions to streamline tax processes. -          Collaborate with internal and external parties to gather tax information and report it to client. -          Monitor and analyze proposed and newly enacted tax legislation and regulations and communicate relevant information to clients.What You Need for this PositionMinimum 2-5 years of tax experience with knowledge of corporate, partnership and individual taxationBachelors and/or Master’s Degree in Accounting/TaxCPA or MST license preferredThis opportunity is ideal for individuals with Big Four, national or regional firm experience. Must have proficiency in Microsoft Office including Excel, Word with tax software experience highly desirable.What's In It for YouBase Salary $75,000-$95,000Health, vision, dental, long-term disability, and life insurance (100% coverage for employees). Paid time off (20 days PTO for all tax professionals) as well as profit sharing and a 401K package.So, if you are a Senior Tax Analyst with experience, please apply today!
                

                    Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Responsible for suggesting methods to improve area operations, efficiency and service to both internal and external customers.- Assist manager with daily operations of customer support to include the development of analyses and implementation.- Conduct client training sessions, including preparing and distributing training materials.- Interact closely with the sales department to provide support, research, analysis and reports,What You Need for this Position- Approximately 1-3 years of customer service and/or training experience.- Knowledge of healthcare industry, preferably the pharmaceutical and managed care segments-  Working knowledge of Microsoft programs: Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Access.- Strong communication, planning, follow-up, writing and organizational skills.  - Proven presentation and facilitation skills.  - Ability to work under deadline pressure, and with little daily supervision. - Capability to learn and train end-users on software applications.  - Ability to document and analyze broad issues and concerns for product enhancement and improvements.What's In It for You- Career growth, work in an exciting and growing field- Join a team of competent, dedicated and hard working professionals- Find yourself working in a fun, and innovative environmentSo, if you are a Client Services Analyst with experience, please apply today!

Title: Software Performance Test Analyst
Description:
If you are a Software Performance Test Analyst with experience, please read on!***Must be willing to re-locate to Seattle, WA ($10,000 Re-Location Assistance)***The Software Performance Test Analyst is responsible for planning and executing performance testing for assigned projects. They must work closely with the project and business stakeholders to establish the correct performance metrics and benchmarks for the systems under test. They are responsible for building and/or contributing on performance test plans for projects and working with the project team to level set expectations, priorities, and deliverables. They must work closely with the Performance Test Leads and Manager to ensure their work is consistent with the methodologies and coverage thresholds for the team.What You Need for this PositionRequired skills, abilities, and certificationsMinimum of seven (7+) years of progressive, hands-on software quality assurance experience.Minimum of four (4+) years of hands-on, progressive experience in performance testing.Minimum of two (2+) years of programming in an object-oriented programming language.Demonstrable experience in JAVA/C#/C/C++ or equivalent is requiredExperience with ERP Application SAP requiredExperience with performance testing and/or development with IBM WebSphereExperience with HP Load Runner or similar Load Testing Tool is required.Strong understanding of performance test methodologies and strategies is required.Proficiency with any of MS SQL/ORACLE/DB2 is required.Understand and be able to use monitoring tools like - SCOM / Dynatrace / Splunk.Skilled in translating the development and testing requirements within the project into performance test scripts and scenarios.Able to create, maintain, and execute scripts using multiple protocols and able to quickly learn new protocols.Expert level skills in performance test tool utilization, including scripting, building and executing scenarios, collecting and analyzing performance metrics.Able to customize automated test scripts through the use of programming languages.Skills and experience required to directly interface with subject matter experts and technical groups (architects, system designers, operations, etc.) to resolve problems encountered during performance testing.Strong understanding of Waterfall and Agile SDLC is preferred.Recommended skills, abilities, and certificationsExperience working with Visual Studio Team Test and Team Foundation Server or HP ALM is preferred.Demonstrable experience with web services development and testing is preferred.Proficiency with XML, SOAP, and WSDL is preferred.Experience with performance testing and/or development in an IBM iSeries environment is helpful.What's In It for You$90K - $120KHealthDentalVisionPTOSo, if you are a Software Performance Test Analyst with experience, please apply today!

Title: Senior Application Security Analyst/Developer
Description:
If you are a Senior Application Security Analyst with experience, please read on! We are looking for a Developer who has a great interest in Security, and can liaison between the development team and the application security team.What You Will Be DoingGeneral Qualifications:-The senior application security analyst will work with the various development teams to implement application security practices that meet our defined policies and standards for information security.-The senior application security analyst must analyze information security systems/applications; make recommendations and develop security measures to protect information against unauthorized modification or loss.-The senior application security analyst will serve as subject matter expert for best practices and security controlsEfforts will include:-Serving as a subject matter expert for security in application projects-Driving secure application development practices and a secure development mentality-Managing the application vulnerability assessment process and tools (SAST and DAST) focused on web, client-server, and mobile applications-Identifying, communicating, and driving the resolution of vulnerabilities-Developing and updating security patterns aligned with security requirements-Identifying application security requirements for projects-Providing reports to development management and business management on the status of vulnerability remediation for their applications-Performing functional requirement reviews and technical design reviews-Coordinating and collaborating with server infrastructure engineering, network infrastructure engineering, business application development, and database administration functions to ensure confidentiality, integrity, and availability of corporate infrastructure meets business demands-Performing other security-related projects that may be assigned according to skillsWhat You Need for this PositionTechnical Experience & Qualifications:-Bachelor’s degree or greater in a technical or business discipline-4-6 years or more of experience, primarily in application development, information security, or a related field, preferably in the financial sector and/or supporting IT Risk or Information Security initiatives-Experience and technical proficiency in major object-oriented programming languages, web front-end languages, frameworks, and libraries (Java, .Net, C++, JavaScript, JSON, SCALA, Groovy, Spring, Log4x, etc.)-Experience and technical proficiency with modern application packaging, deployment, containerizing, bug tracking tools and other supporting tools (Jenkins, Maven, Docker, Kubernetes Jira, Rally, etc.)-Experience and technical proficiency with modern source code management and software repository systems (Git/GitHub, Perforce, Subversion, Team Foundation Server, etc.)-Experience and technical proficiency with developing applications specifically for AWS and Azure Cloud hosting environments-Experience with Static Application Security Testing (SAST), Dynamic Application Security Testing (DAST) tools, and enterprise architecture tools-Deep understanding of OWASP Top 10 and SANS Top 25 vulnerabilities-Strong experience with data visualization concepts and tools-Ability to analyze data using Excel including use of complex Excel macros / scripts for reporting purposes; some development experience is preferable-Experience with Veracode (or other SAST/DAST tools), Jira, ServiceNow, and Splunk is preferable-CISSP, GIAC, CISA, CISM, TOGAF certifications preferable-Ability to work individually and as part of a team-Strong written and oral communication skills-Strong presentation skills; ability to adjust message and filter details based on audience (e.g. technical, business, management)So, if you are a Senior Application Security Analyst with experience, please apply today!
                

                    Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.
Skills:
Preferred Skills
                
                    
                            
                                
                                    
                                    SAST
                                    
                                
                            
                            
                                
                                    
                                    DAST
                                    
                                
                            
                            
                                
                                    
                                    CISSP

Description:

Title: Fuel Pricing & Logistics Analyst
Description:
We are actively recruiting for a Logistics / Pricing Analyst Assistant!  Perhaps you are a recent college graduate with strong analytical skills in logistics and pricing.  Or perhaps no degree but several years of hands on experience allowing for you to hit the ground running.  Core skills include proficiency in Excel as well as the knack for analyzing data to develop and execute pricing strategy.    We are very excited to connect with you.  Please take a moment and make sure we have the most recent copy of your resume as well as answer the skills and questions self assessment.  We will reach out to you shortly!Top Reasons to Work with UsAs a Logistics/Pricing Analyst Assistant, you will become a crucial part of our daily operation and monthly/annual success backing up the Logistics/Pricing Manager. Over time you will build the needed tools and to provide the critical analysis to ensure we get the job done on time every day. As you grow in this career position, you will have the opportunity to grow with our organization and develop a well-rounded background in several areas of this industry.What You Will Be Doing-  Build new reports, refine and systematize existing reports.-  Manage and maintain KSS/Kalibrate Pricing system with IT team-  Manage and achieve corporate fiscal plans by setting fuel product street pricing-  Utilize and analyze multiple corporate reports and P & L ‘s-  Act as liaison between the home office personnel, Corporate Department Managers, Area and Store Managers, Supplier Agents and our third party contracted carriers.-  Continuously monitor inventory volume and flow to ensure product arrives when needed and in a costly manner.-  Shift product loading around market changes to maximize cost effective purchases-  Review remote dispatch offices daily delivery plans-  Maintain product allocations provided by our fuel product suppliers-  Be a part of strategic special projects.-  Review oil futures and world markets, global events, for trends, industry forecasting-  Use analytical data from research for pricing strategy development and executionWhat You Need for this PositionAt least 3 Years of experience and knowledge of:- Logistics Analysis- Pricing Analysis- Industry Forecasting- Excel- Development Pricing Strategy- Maintain Product AllocationNice to have:- Kalibrate Pricing- Franklin Fueling Systems- DTN Fuel Buying- Pinnacle FuelSmartBachelor's degree or proven track record in the field.What's In It for You- Vacation/PTO- Medical- Dental- Vision- Bonus- 401(k)So, if you are a Logistics Analyst with at least 3 years of experience, please apply today!

Title: Microsoft Tier 1/2 Support Analyst with rotating shift
Description:
We are looking for a Support Analyst to provide day-to-day 1st and 2nd line technical phone and email support to our global client base.Notes: There is a 24x7 after hours support call rotation requirement (for rarely occurring critical production issues only) with a coverage period of 1 out of every ~6-8 weeks.You must be able to work alternate shifts to accommodate clients in different time zones, including 12pm-8pm.The role will include travel, in US and Continental Europe, as well as to our head office and customer locations in the UK.What You Will Be Doing1. Provide 1st and 2nd line customer support as required; support activities include logging calls within the incident management system, assistance over the phone and/or via remote system access, performing problem investigation / verification, providing work-around, providing customer feedback and updates, closing calls.2. Ensure all calls are handled following support workflow and within SLA,3. Work efficiently with minimum distraction and maintain reasonable backlog4. Communicate clearly and precisely with customers to determine expectations for resolutions and provides workarounds to product defects5. Handle customer escalations, including those with high visibility6. Participate in forums, respond to technical questions, share product knowledge with peers as much as possible7. Create knowledge-base articles, test documentation, user guides, technical application notes, FAQs and similar customer-facing materials8. Build, configure and manage Customer-specific test environments using Virtualized Microsoft Windows servers and clients, SQL server and Oracle DBs, and IIS Web servers9. Keep abreast of appropriate Life Sciences regulatory labeling requirements10. Conform with Corporate Quality, Support and Services procedures11. Perform informal and formal execution of test scripts and completion of corresponding Validation documentation as required by Regulatory and Quality guidelinesWhat You Need for this PositionBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, CIS, MIS, Computing Systems, or related technical field and / or a background or experience in a Software technical support role1) Support skills:- A logical approach to problem solving and trouble shooting- Able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision-  Willingness to go the ‘extra mile’ to ensure customer success and satisfaction- Attention to details & actively listening- Able to balance the demands of multiple clients simultaneously- Easily approachable, reacts calmly under stressful situations- Receive constructive criticism well- Maintains confidentiality- Able to work under pressure- Ability to document support cases clearly, concisely and timely- Desire and Ability to quickly learn new concepts and technology- Knowledge of software support procedures and practices preferred but not required- Knowledge and experience on KCS knowledge management practice desired but not required- Able to work alternate shifts to accommodate clients in different time zones, including 12p-8pm and 24x7 rotation during part of year.- Able to travel to client sites both in the US and Europe2) Technical skills:- Fluent with Microsoft Windows Operating Systems both client and server- Experience with Microsoft IIS 6 and above- Knowledge and experience with relational databases, SQL Server 2000 and above and/or Oracle 10g and above- Experience with Microsoft Virtual Machine/Server, Hyper-V or VMWare- Basic understanding of computer networks and how to trouble shoot networking related issues- Knowledge about Web based software applications and how to trouble shoot- Proven experience in either document management, printing and or labeling solutions across the enterprise- Knowledge and experience in web services- Knowledge and experience in trouble shooting and supporting of windows based applications- Knowledge and experience with N-tier applications- Knowledge and experience with ODBC preferred- Comfortable and experienced with complex database driven client-server and web based applications3) Communication and personal skills:- Able to write clearly and concisely with a good attention to detail and quality (fit for purpose)- Excellent verbal and written communication skills including active listening and questioning skills- Communicate effectively with manager and colleagues- Communicate in a professional manner when working with clients- Able to build internal and external relationships- Effective team player in both co-located and geographically distributed environmentsWhat's In It for YouOpportunity for career advancement includes transitioning to a “Hypercare” Customer Success Specialist with focused, proactive assistance as a product, solution and domain expert, up to and including being part of the implementation team and/or post-implementation Customer team supporting and/or using the application. Longer term career options beyond Sr. Support roles include Implementation Consultant, Pre-Sales Engineer, and Technical Account Manager.So, if you are a Support Analyst with experience, please apply today!

Title: Senior Survey Analyst - Civil Engineering & Land Surveying
Description:

Title: Web Analytics Specialist
Description:
We are a digital ad agency with a proven reputation for developing some of the most innovative B2C and B2B campaigns over the last 20 years.  Due to continued agency growth and customer need, we have an immediate need for a Web Optimization Analyst who is an expert at analyzing websites, aggregating data and creating web optimization recommendations.  This is a full time, direct hire role based in our Cincinnati location.Do you have 3+ years of experience in a Data Analytics or Web  Optimization role with strong Google Analytics skills?If so... read on!What You Need for this Position*  3+ years of experience in both Paid Search & Analytics (preferably Google Analytics) in planning, execution, optimization,  reporting, and content development*  Excellent communication skills as this person will be heavy client facing  *  Proactive, detail oriented thinker*  Advanced knowledge of Excel, Google Docs, PowerPoint, Keynote*  Familiar with Google Tag Manager, Google Tag Assistant, browser console debugging, social media analytics tools, consumer behavior/research tools, and/or APIs is a plus*  Strong understanding of: SEO, Paid Search, Digital Media, Social Media, Content Strategy, UX, Ecommerce, Email Marketing, or CRM Role definition*  Previous healthcare industry experience is plus!What You Will Be Doing*  Analyze paid media data across multiple channels (Paid Search, Display, Video/Pre-Roll, etc.) and develop strategic insights that drive current campaigns performance and future campaign planning*  Develop marketing strategies that include multiple (3-5) channels, messaging & testing plans*  Review web analytics data related to search solution *  Continually improve upon the insights gained from the data*  Proactively identify trends in multivariate data and translate findings into prioritized/actionable recommendations*  Perform user behavior and keyword research using a variety of sources*  Constantly learning of new of search engine marketing and web analytics practices*  Create regular reporting, assist with ad hoc analysis, and provide proactive recommendations to optimize an ecommerce platform*  Deliver reports, media plans, etc. and can lead and own client relationships*  Create client-ready media plans, reports, etcSo, if you have  3+ years of experience in a Data Title: Data Scientist
Description:
If you are a Data Scientist who enjoys building back-end data systems and creating clean data structures, please read on!Based in Los Angeles, we are leader in the metals industry for close to a 100 years and going strong! We started as a small business serving the local Los Angeles community and thrived in the metals industry boom in the United States,. Overtime, we experienced tremendous success and became a Fortune 500 company an appreciate and are proud of the culture we’ve created. Our leadership has been a part of this company for 10+ years and our turnover is exceptionally low.We also have an endless supply of engaging engineering work to be done and are currently hiring a Data Scientist to join us. We're looking for hungry people who are passionate about redefining the data science space. We offer a true work/life balance with a fun and dynamic work environment. If you are ready to join a truly stable company that has roots in the industry and endless career growth and advancement, we are the company for you!Top Reasons to Work with Us1. True work/life balance!2. Join a world class engineering team.3. Experience tremendous personal and professional success.What You Will Be DoingAs a Data Scientist/Engineer you will be responsible for the following;- Build machine learning and statistical models to to address business needs. (Boosting trees, neural networks, or support vector machines, scikit-learn, spark MLlib, tensorflow or H2O: We're open to solving problems in many different ways.)- Perform data mining and feature engineering. - Dig into the numbers and develop truly data-driven features.- Architect, develop, and launch automated ETL (Extraction, Transformation, Loading) processes between multiple systems.- Design and develop data ingestion and storage systems with high availability and reliability that can scale.- Assist and lead the development of feature improvements to our suite of proprietary data-intensive tools- Prepare data flow diagrams and technical requirements for internal and external data flows.- Define, document and advocate best practices for data usage.- Work with other Engineering teams to present current finding, gather feedback, and iterate.- Create alerts to ensure continual data availability, accuracy and cleanlinessWe believe the most powerful models can only be built from the most predictive features, and we let the data do the talking!What You Need for this Position- Strong experience with Python or Scala - Experience with MySQL, SQL (write complex SQL for data manipulation)- Experience in data processing and building production models- Experience in developing ETL solutions- Excellent analytical skills, and strategic thinking/visioning- Experience working with back-end data systems to create clean data structures- Experience with Spark is a plus!- Knowledge of MPP/Columnar data warehouse solutions Redshift, Vertica are a plus!- Strong strong written and verbal communicator- Masters or Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Operations Research, Statistics or Applied Math with in-depth understanding of machine learning models and/or statistical analysis requiredWhat's In It for You- Competitive salary- Generous equity package- Benefits (Health, Dental, Vision)- 401K match- PTO- Holidays- Team events/outingsSo, if you are ready to enjoy a True Work/Life balance as a Data Scientist, Please Apply Today!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
If you are a Data Scientist with experience, please read on! The set of problems that we tackle is incredibly diverse and complex. They cut across optimization, prediction, modeling, inference, and behavioral science. We research and develop the algorithms and models that make our solution intelligent, as well as implementing, scaling, and maintaining the code that powers our production systems.The ideal candidate is a critical thinker with experience and background in commercial life science domain, passionate about solving mathematical and behavioral problems with data, and is excited about working in a fast-paced, innovative and collaborative environment.e.What You Will Be DoingWork with Data Scientists, Product Managers, Customer Success and Services teams to frame a problem, both mathematically and within the business contextWrite production-level code; collaborate with Engineering team to implement algorithms in production and productize common solutionsPerform exploratory data analysis to gain a deeper understanding of the problemConstruct and fit statistical, machine learning and optimization modelsUtilize commonly used computing and database environments to get the data that you need and implement a working prototype of the formulated model.Learn and apply new methodologies in the intersection of applied math / probability / statistics / machine learning / computer science.Make intelligent approximations to the model if required to make it scalable.Analyze experimental and observational data; communicate findings; facilitate launch decisionsIdentify data sources that could be used to test assumptionsWhat You Need for this PositionMS/PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Math, or related areas. Exceptionally strong candidates with a BS and relevant work experience welcome.Proven track record of developing algorithms for production ready recommendation or prediction systems using languages and big data platforms such as Scala, Python, R, Java, Spark, Cassandra, and HadoopExperience working in an agile software development environmentPassion for solving unstructured and non-standard mathematical and behavioral problemsEnd-to-end experience with data, including querying, aggregation, analysis, and visualizationExperience implementing machine learning algorithmsExperience with analytics for commercial life science and pharma-specific analyses a big plusExcellent communication and presentation skills, being able to explain complex problems and the solutions applied, feeling comfortable in being part of the sales process, supporting the sales team, engaging with customers and presenting technical solutions to a nontechnical audienceExperience in data science and data analytics for life science industry especially in GTM strategy and execution a big plusHigh-energy self-starter with a passion for your work, attention to detail, and a positive attitudeGreat team player, willingness to collaborate and communicate with others to solve a problem.So, if you are a Data Scientist with experience, please apply today!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
If you are a Data Scientist with experience, please read on!You enjoy transforming rough insights and basic hypotheses to concrete reality. You work from the raw data all the way to the presentation of results. You will build scalable machine learning campaigns to solve various real world retail industry problems mixing signals from product data, location data, click stream and transaction data. The use cases we try to solve are million dollar retail industry problems. The use cases are already identified, and your job is to come and solve those use cases, crunching data from very large data sets and building scalable ml campaigns. This is a firsthand opportunity for you to solve those problems and make an immediate impact.We are looking for an algorithm-oriented engineer/data scientist well versed in machine learning and statistics to join our team.What You Will Be Doing-Solve machine learning problems over very large data sets-Develop scalable machine learning campaigns and deploy that into production-Conduct exploratory data analysis using statistical packages such as R, Spark-Design and create internal and customer-facing web service APIs to access the model-Classify and categorize behaviors based on mobile, web, and other signals-Implement notification customer campaigns that generate liftWhat You Need for this Position-3+ years experience in developing scalable marketing campaigns using data-Solid understanding of statistics and machine learning-Experience presenting analytics in quantitative and visual formats-Experience writing high-performance code to meet marketing goals-Previous data driven marketing wins to achieve hard ROI goals strongly preferredWhat's In It for You-Medical, Dental and Vision -401k -Flexible work schedule, WFH option -EquitySo, if you are a Data Scientist with experience, please apply today!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
If you are a Data Analyst with experience, please read on!What You Will Be DoingAs a Data Analyst, you will analyze hyper-local data sources to develop accurate interpretations of audiences and behaviors, and develop data structures to facilitate the analysis.  A mixture of analytical approaches are required, including raw data mining, data visualization, application of rules and heuristics and supervised / unsupervised machine learning techniques. We deal with extremely large data sets requiring the design and development of highly memory- and cpu-efficient methods.  We use a mixture of commercial, open source and home-grown solutions. Responsibilities:• Raw data analysis – assessing quality, cleansing, structuring for downstream processing• Design and prototype of accurate and scalable prediction algorithms• Functional and technical documentation of designs• Collaboration with engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to production• Communication of results to partners and customersWhat You Need for this Position• Creative and pragmatic quantitatively minded individual with a passion for understanding location and human behavior• Problem solving – ability to identify issues quickly and rapidly determine root cause and effective resolution approach• Data management – familiarity with Hadoop ecosystem and SQL• Proficiency with Python, Java or Scala• Software engineering skills - fundamental coding skills enabling the building of analytical pipelines and the development of prototypes for core company products and systems• Data analysis – solid data analysis skills applied to business problems, including slicing & dicing large datasets, and application of analytical techniques such as statistical methods and machine learning• Communication - excellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to communicate technical topics to non-technical individuals• Execution - ability to manage own time and work effectively with others on projectsEducation/Experience:• Bachelors degree in Statistics/Applied Math/Computer Science or related field required• 2+ years relevant job experienceSo, if you are a Data Analyst with experience, please apply today!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
If you are a Data Engineer with experience, please read on!Located in Downtown Seattle, WA we are a rapidly growing start up in the transportation industry. We are looking for a Backend Software Engineer on a team that consolidates, curates and serves all user data for us and our partners. This is a massively scalable, fully-online/real-time data store containing all information about our users.  It fuels the entire business, from promos and incentives, to marketing and ad campaigns; from in-app customer experience to online customer service.  You'll be working closely with the Product and Business Data teams, as well as teams across the company, to collect, scale and serve the business data for all our real-time applications and ad serving.  This system is the most valuable data asset, and it is critical to building the next generation of personalized custom experiences for our users.What's In It for YouWe offer a competitive compensation package including but not limited to:- A highly competetive base salary (DOE)- Full benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, Life)- Bonuses!- Employee Stock purchase plan, stock options- 401K - Generous PTO/Sick time- Collaborative Culture- Tons of growth potentialWhat You Will Be Doing- Creating and curating bigtables (e.g. HBase, Cassandra) for storing and serving petabytes of data- Building denormalized data models for optimizing access patterns as the business grows- Designing and implementing APIs for controlling data access and serving the business- Building and delivering ETLs and data federation pipelines- Solving complex multi-dimensional business and legal constraints related to onshoring and sharing of data- Evaluating technology stacks for increasing performance, handling large pseudo-analytic queries, and reducing infrastructure costs- Engaging in service capacity and demand planning, software performance analysis, tuning and optimization- Working with product and experience teams to define and prototype feature specifications- Working with business teams to model and serve the data for personalization and user experience customization- Work with infrastructure teams in building and scaling back-end services, as well as performing root cause analysis investigations- Collaborating across stakeholders such as data scientists, application developers, and department heads to deliver a technical solution that meets their unique needs- Participating in code and design reviews to maintain our high development standardsWhat You Need for this PositionAt least 3 Years of professional software development experience, a Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or other related field, and knowledge of: - Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms, distributed systems, and asynchronous architectures- Hands-on coder who has built backend services that handle high volume traffic- Strong understanding of system performance and scaling- Expert in at least 1 of the following languages: Go, C++, Java, Scala, Kotlin.  Expertise with multiple languages is strongly preferredNice to have, but not required, knowledge of: - Hadoop ecosystem (e.g. Spark/Storm/Hbase etc.) or equivalent, data modeling, and using various database methodologies such relational, columnar and NoSQL- Experience with Maching Learning or Data ScienceSo, if you are a Data Engineer with experience, please apply today!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Based in San Francisco, CA - We are on a mission to revolutionize how companies analyze and plan their businesses. By implementing our next-generation cloud platform, companies are able to excel in every business capacity and make informed decisions, while driving faster, more effective planning processes. Our platform is already being used by hundreds of Fortune 2000 companies and we are continuing to grow!Top Reasons to Work with Us- The opportunity to work for one of the coolest companies in global tech – our awards include Top 10 Most Innovative Enterprise Software Companies (Fast Company 2016) & a double Magic Quadrant Visionary (Gartner, 2015)- Highly competitive salaries and compensation packages - we’re very serious about attracting the very best technologists in the industry.- A long list of incredible benefits worthy of a leading Silicon Valley tech firm (inc. stock options, bonuses, healthcare, flexible working hours, global travel opportunities and much more.- Huge technical problems to solve – you will constantly be learning and pushing boundaries, working with some of the smartest people around!What You Will Be DoingAs a Senior Data Scientist you will help disrupt the future of business planning through Machine Learning. Analyze a massive amount of data from Supply Chain, Sales, Marketing, Finance, to IT & Ops to develop predictive models to help our enterprise customers make better business decisions. Unlike many startups, we have many customers and a lot of real business data to tackle real problems.What You Need for this PositionREQUIRED SKILLS:- 6+ years of experience with advanced AI techniques (machine learning, predictive analytics, optimization, semantic analysis, time-series analysis, advanced visualization) to real-world problems- 2+ years experience in Deep Learning- Proficiency in Python and/or RBONUS SKILLS:- Experience with frameworks such as Tensorflow, Theano, Keras, Torch, is desirable.- Spark: pyspark MLlib (running ML algorithms on local Hadoop cluster environment), *AWS or machine learning on Azure.- Master’s in Computer Science, Operations Research, Statistics, Applied Math.So, if you are a Data Scientist with experience, please apply today!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
If you are a Data Scientist with SQL and Modeling experience, please read on!Join the world's fastest growing platform for moving and holding any form of money or commodity, instantly and securely.Our company combines a platform app model with payment connectivity to offer financial services to a global market. We empower innovation in financial services through a platform approach where app developers and FinTech partners can leverage our reach through licensed relationships with banks and financial services partners around the world. Built on a core of proprietary technologies and e-money apps, our company embraces a future where people and businesses around the world have access to safe, transparent, fair and affordable financial services.As a key member of the Analytics/Finance team, you will be responsible for data-driven insights that enable our company to optimize business processes and financial decision. You will gather, organize and aggregate large sets of data in order to produce meaningful business insight and solve critical challenges that give us a competitive edge. If you love leading and developing a strategic vision, solving complex problems, driving business strategy and increasing overall profitability by developing deep analytic approaches and infrastructure, this role is for you!What You Will Be Doing•Build predictive and behavioral analyses models that are used by the marketing, underwriting & sales teams to enhance targeting, increase revenue, and allocate resources more efficiently•Develop a behavior-based model of the customer lifecycle•Evaluate specific product performance and sales performance to make recommendations to Senior Management to increase productivity and drive efficiencies•Identify the necessary data and equations to answer business questions•Translate business questions into definable metrics and vice versa. Ability to explain the story the numbers are telling, test hypotheses with numerical data, and identify problem areas•Research competitors, adjacent markets, and current market trends to discover new business or process opportunitiesWhat You Need for this Position•Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as mathematics, economics, statistics, informatics, data science, or engineering required, advanced degree strongly preferred•Experience with statistical analysis, complex SQL queries, and business modeling•Demonstrated knowledge of applying data mining techniques (i.e. classification, & clustering, time series forecasting, Simulation and system modeling), statistics and information retrieval methods to real-world data•Expertise in predictive modeling using both supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning techniques. Must have knowledge and experience in the following: generalized linear models, model validation and testing, dimensionality reduction, clustering, and Bayesian approaches to data analysis•Strong foundations in the design and interpretation of experiments•Experience working with a data warehouse environment and leveraging models within a cloud based environment•Proven ability to transform the results of complex modeling procedures into concrete decisions and actions•Demonstrated proficiency with R or PythonWhat's In It for You- Competitive base salary of $115k-$155k DOE- Bonus - 401(k) w/ matching- Stock options/ real ownership of the company- Flexible schedule and unlimited vacation- Remote work option (inquire)- Comprehensive health benefits and competitive additional offeringsSo, if you are a Data Scientist with SQL and Modeling experience, please apply today!
                

                    Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Title: Data Analytics Specialist - Data Visualization/Dashboarding
Description:
If you are a talented Data Analytics Specialist with strong communication skills, please read on!Headquartered in New York, we are a very well-established and highly prolific education organization that is making a colossal splash in the industry. With our schools consistently ranking in the top 1%-5% in a wide variety of studies, we are making history every single day. We have achieved this because it's our calling. It's what we love to do! Providing an exploration-driven curriculum focused on each individual child is the linchpin of our business and we are currently experiencing tremendously rapid growth due to our communities calling for more!We are looking for a bright and skilled Data Analytics Specialist who yearns to do impactful, purpose-driven work to join our team. The ideal candidate will possess strong experience with SAS, R, or Python along with SQL, ETL, KPI Reporting/Analysis, and advanced Excel skills. They will also have strong Communication, Interpersonal, and Presentation skills. If this sounds like you, we would love to tell you more about this phenomenal opportunity!We are happy to offer the right candidate very competitive compensation that includes a base salary of up to $100k (DOE) and exceptional benefits.Top Reasons to Work with Us1. Passionate, Driven, and All-Around Amazing Team2. Huge Growth Potential3. Exciting and Rewarding Work!What You Will Be Doing- Conducting data analysis in support of a variety of analytic solutions- Creating and producing forecasts, reports, ad hoc requests, dashboards, etc.- Creating and disseminating information and tools that empower schools to do their jobs effectively- Providing real-time customer service to school-based teams in order to maintain operational efficiency across our network- Creating project plans and timelines to support team priorities and goals, and holding team members accountable- Developing databases and implementing data standards and data quality monitoring tools to filter and clean data- Preparing monthly dashboard reports, identifying trends and presenting thoughtful, actionable solutions- Skillfully and confidently presenting operations metrics and school health data to diverse constituencies- Crafting and telling stories using data to advance department initiatives and gain buy-in from senior management and school teams- Training Network and school-based staff on data systems- Documenting and training end users on reports and dashboardsWhat You Need for this PositionRequired:- Data Analysis, Visualization, and Standardization/Cleansing- SAS, R, or Python- SQL- ETL- KPI Reporting/Analysis- Excel (Analyzing, manipulating, and presenting large amounts of data)- Strong Communication, Interpersonal, and Presentation SkillsNice to Haves:- Database Development- Trello, SurveyGizmo, Periscope, Docusign, EMMA, or School MessengerWhat's In It for You- Healthcare Paid for 100%- 401k Matching- 4 Weeks PTOSo if you're a talented Data Analytics Specialist, please apply TODAY!!

Description:
Are you a Senior Data Engineer with Data Pipeline, Python & Machine Learning experience?  If so, read on...We harness the power of machine learning and predictive analytics to discover the fastest-growing companies in the consumer & retail sector.  We want to bring the data-driven revolution that has occurred in the public markets to the private markets, starting with consumer & retail.Our mission is to help entrepreneurs thrive by giving them the resources and capital they need.  We have been named one of the Top 5 Most Disruptive Companies in Finance by CNBC, one of the 50 Best Fintech Innovators by KPMG, and one of America's Most Promising Companies by Forbes.  We are backed by top-tier investors including Google Ventures, Union Square Ventures (backers of Etsy/Kickstarter), and the ex CEOs/Presidents of Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, Thomson Reuters, the Stanford Endowment and Capital One.What You Will Be Doing- Help us scale a complex machine learning data pipeline- Use technologies like Python, Postgres, and apache sparkWhat You Need for this Position- Experience as a Data Engineer- Machine Learning Experience- Python Exp- Worked on large scale data infrastructure (Hadoop Stack, Spark, Kafka, Hive, etc.)- BSCS or Related DegreeWhat's In It for You- Work in a Machine Learning Environment!- Great compensation package- Awesome work environment and friendly team!So if you are a Senior Data Engineer with data pipeline, python & machine learning experience....please apply today!
                

                    Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.
Skills:

                                    Data Pipeline
                                    
                                
                            
                            
                                
                                    
                                    Python
                                    
                                
                            
                            
                                
                                    
                                    Machine Learning

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
If you are a Senior Data Scientist with strong programming experience with a machine learning background, please read on!We are an extremely well funded (VC backed) leader in the predictive analytics industry with several openings right now.  As a member of the data science team, you will work on groundbreaking R&D projects to leverage massive structured, unstructured, transactional and real-time data sets from a variety of sources.  The goal is to analyze customer usage patterns and make actionable statistically robust recommendations that are impactful to the business case. Job Title: Senior Data Scientist Location: East San Mateo, close to Foster CityPay: $185k-$215k base + 15-20% bonus + stock optionsWhat You Will Be Doing- Combine an understanding of the business goals with data analysis and machine learning- Cooperate with the Business Intelligence team to design and execute replicable data acquisition and utilization processes.- Investigate new data sources.  Acquire, analyze, clean and structure data.- Use state of the art machine learning techniques to improve and expand existing modelsWhat You Need for this Position- 5+ years working experience - Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline - Java OR Python - Hadoop (Hive, Pig, Spark)- NoSQL (MongoDB, Cassandra, DynamoDB, etc.)- Data-mining / analytics experience including applied techniques in data mining, machine learning, or scientific computingWhat's In It for You- STRONG base pay right around $200k + bonus up to 20% + stock options + FULL benefits- Potential for remote workSo, if you are a Senior Data Scientist with experience, please apply today!
                

                    Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.
